domain.impl

Class ShortTermScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • domain.impl.ShortTermScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlInterface, InterSchedulerInterface, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ShortTermScheduler
extends java.lang.Thread
implements ControlInterface, InterSchedulerInterface
    This class is responsible for executing a scheduling strategy in a given list of processes that it receives by implementing the `InterSchedulerInterface`. It also implements `ControlInterface` so that the simulation can be manipulated.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      ShortTermScheduler(SchedulingStrategy schedulingStrategy, int quantumSizeMs)

      Displays the names of the processes in all the queues.

      Returns the total number of processes currently managed by this scheduler.

      Resumes the simulation and notify the user of the event.

      When the `Thread` is started, this method will run an infinite loop, executing the `schedulingStrategy` until the simulation is stopped.

      Setter for the `notificationInterface`.
      void startSimulation()
      Starts the simulation, calling the `start()` method of this thread if it wasn't alive and notify the user of the event.
      void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation, clearing all the queues and notify the user of the event.
      void suspendSimulation()
      Pauses the simulation and notify the user of the event.

        public void addProcess(Process process)

        Specified by:
        addProcess in interface InterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        process - - Process instance that will be added to the ready queue

      • getProcessLoad

        public int getProcessLoad()
        Returns the total number of processes currently managed by this scheduler. Is equal to the number of processes in the ready queue, plus the number of processes in the blocked queue, plus one, if it is currently executing a process.
        Specified by:
        getProcessLoad in interface InterSchedulerInterface
        Returns:
        quantity of processes currently managed by `ShortTermScheduler`

      • startSimulation

        public void startSimulation()
        Starts the simulation, calling the `start()` method of this thread if it wasn't alive and notify the user of the event.
        Specified by:
        startSimulation in interface ControlInterface

      • displayProcessQueues

        public void displayProcessQueues()
        Displays the names of the processes in all the queues.
        Specified by:
        displayProcessQueues in interface ControlInterface

      • run

        public void run()
        When the `Thread` is started, this method will run an infinite loop, executing the `schedulingStrategy` until the simulation is stopped. If the simulation is stopped or suspended, it will sleep for 1 ms each iteration.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
